alert.note: Alert for Rusk; Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Smith and northwestern Rusk Counties through 545 PM CST... At 500 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Whitehouse, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Tyler, Henderson, Whitehouse, Overton, Troup, New London, Arp, Turnertown, Joinerville and New Chapel Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CST for northeastern Texas.
